title: How will Telegraph readers vote in the December general election?
text:
It will be the first December general election since 1923. Despite this, it's the third time that Britons have been sent to the polls within five years. Some have speculated that it could be the messiest, most important election of modern times, but how are Telegraph readers feeling just seven weeks away from an election that will define a generation?

Not to make the same mistakes as his predecessor, Boris Johnson was cautious with his approach when addressing his MPs at Westminster: "It’s time for the country to come together and go forward. It will be a tough election but we will do the best we can.” On the contrary, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn declared that the forthcoming election is "going...
description: It will be the first December general election since 1923.
